sndlib.core.statistics
Enum SolutionStatisticValueKeys

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<SolutionStatisticValueKeys>
      sndlib.core.statistics.SolutionStatisticValueKeys
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SolutionStatisticValueKeys>, SolutionStatisticValueKey
public enum SolutionStatisticValueKeys
extends java.lang.Enum<SolutionStatisticValueKeys>
implements SolutionStatisticValueKey

This enumeration implements all currently defined statistical values of a solution of a network design problem.

For a given solved problem a single statistical value can be calculated by invoking the calculateValue(SolvedProblem) method of the corresponding enumeration constant. To compute, e.g., the total link capacity cost of a given solution, write this line:

   SolutionStatisticValueKeys.LINK_TOTAL_CAPACITY_COST.calculateValue(solvedProblem)


To calculate the entire statistics of a given solved problem make use of the static factory methods of SolutionStatistics, like:

   SolutionStatistics.newStatistics(solvedProblem)

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
SolutionStatistics

Enum Constant Detail

LINK_PRE_INSTALLED_CAPACITY_COST

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_PRE_INSTALLED_CAPACITY_COST
Calculates the total pre-installed capacity cost of all links contained in the solution topology.

LINK_ADDITIONAL_MODULE_CAPACITY_COST

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_ADDITIONAL_MODULE_CAPACITY_COST
Calculates the total cost of the additional modules installed on all links contained in the solution topology.

The costs of the pre-installed link capacities are not considered.

LINK_TOTAL_CAPACITY_COST

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_TOTAL_CAPACITY_COST
Calculates the total cost of all link capacities.

The cost is the sum of the pre-installed and the additional capacity costs.

See Also:
LINK_PRE_INSTALLED_CAPACITY_COST, LINK_ADDITIONAL_MODULE_CAPACITY_COST

LINK_FIXED_CHARGE_COST

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_FIXED_CHARGE_COST
Calculates the sum of the setup costs imposed on all link contained in the solution topology.

LINK_TOTAL_COST

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_TOTAL_COST
Calculates the total link cost.

The total link cost covers the capacity cost, the fixed-charge cost and the routing cost.

See Also:
LINK_TOTAL_CAPACITY_COST, LINK_FIXED_CHARGE_COST, LINK_TOTAL_ROUTING_COST

LINK_NOS_AVG_CAPACITY_USAGE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_NOS_AVG_CAPACITY_USAGE
Calculates the average usage of the link capacities when the network is in the normal operating state (NOS).

The capacity usage of a link is the ratio between the flow on the link and the capacity installed:

  0 <= u = f / c <= 1 where f denotes the link flow and c the capacity installed on that link.

LINK_NOS_MIN_CAPACITY_USAGE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_NOS_MIN_CAPACITY_USAGE
Calculates the minimum usage of the link capacities when the network is in the normal operating state (NOS).

The capacity usage of a link is the ratio between the flow on the link and the capacity installed:

  0 <= u = f / c <= 1 where f denotes the link flow and c the capacity installed on that link.

LINK_NOS_MAX_CAPACITY_USAGE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_NOS_MAX_CAPACITY_USAGE
Calculates the maximum usage of the link capacities when the network is in the normal operating state (NOS).

The capacity usage of a link is the ratio between the flow on the link and the capacity installed:

  0 <= u = f / c <= 1 where f denotes the link flow and c the capacity installed on that link.

NODE_MIN_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_MIN_DEGREE
Calculates the minimum degree over all nodes contained in the solution topology.

The degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links.

NODE_MAX_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_MAX_DEGREE
Calculates the maximum degree over all nodes contained in the solution topology.

The degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links.

NODE_AVG_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_AVG_DEGREE
Calculates the average degree over all nodes contained in the solution topology.

The degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links.

NODE_MIN_IN_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_MIN_IN_DEGREE
Calculates the minimum in-degree over all nodes contained in the solution topology.

For a directed link model the in-degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links of which that node is the target. Otherwise there is no definite target node and thus the in-degree is simply the number of its incident links.

NODE_MAX_IN_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_MAX_IN_DEGREE
Calculates the maximum in-degree over all nodes contained in the solution topology.

For a directed link model the in-degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links of which that node is the target. Otherwise there is no definite target node and thus the in-degree is simply the number of its incident links.

NODE_AVG_IN_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_AVG_IN_DEGREE
Calculates the average in-degree over all nodes contained in the solution topology.

For a directed link model the in-degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links of which that node is the target. Otherwise there is no definite target node and thus the in-degree is simply the number of its incident links.

NODE_MIN_OUT_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_MIN_OUT_DEGREE
Calculates the minimum out-degree over all nodes in the solution topology.

For a directed link model the out-degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links of which that node is the source. Otherwise there is no definite target node and thus the in-degree is simply the number of its incident links.

NODE_MAX_OUT_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_MAX_OUT_DEGREE
Calculates the maximum out-degree over all nodes in the solution topology.

For a directed link model the out-degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links of which that node is the source. Otherwise there is no definite target node and thus the in-degree is simply the number of its incident links.

NODE_AVG_OUT_DEGREE

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys NODE_AVG_OUT_DEGREE
Calculates the average out-degree over all nodes in the solution topology.

For a directed link model the out-degree of a node is defined as the number of its incident links of which that node is the source. Otherwise there is no definite target node and thus the in-degree is simply the number of its incident links.

TOTAL_NOS_FLOW

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys TOTAL_NOS_FLOW
Calculates the total flow in the network when it is in the normal operating state (NOS).

LINK_TOTAL_ROUTING_COST

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys LINK_TOTAL_ROUTING_COST
Calculates the total routing cost in the network considering all operating states.

The calculation is done using the following formula:

  \sum_{e \in E} routing_cost(e) * \max_{s \in S} \sum_{d \in D} flow(d,e,s)

MAXIMUM_ADDITIONAL_BACKUP_FLOW

public static final SolutionStatisticValueKeys MAXIMUM_ADDITIONAL_BACKUP_FLOW
Calculates the maximal flow in the network which is additional with respect to the flow in the normal operating state (NOS).

The calculation is done using the following formula:

  \sum{e \in E} \max_{s \in Failstates} \sum_{d \in D} \max{ 0, flow(e,d,s) - flow(e,d,NOS) } for shared protection and unrestricted flow reconfiguration, and   \sum{e \in E} \sum_{d \in D} \max_{s \in Failstates} \max{ 0, flow(e,d,s) - flow(e,d,NOS) } for dedicated 1+1 protection.
